trans-unit.source: Use HttpClient and the rest of the Windows.Web.Http namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.
trans-unit.target: Use HttpClient and the rest of the Windows.Web.Http namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.

trans-unit.source: HttpClient
trans-unit.target: HttpClient

trans-unit.source: HttpClient
trans-unit.target: HttpClient

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: HttpClient
trans-unit.target: HttpClient

trans-unit.source: Windows.Web.Http
trans-unit.target: Windows.Web.Http

trans-unit.source: Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage
trans-unit.target: Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage

trans-unit.source: Use [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) and the rest of the [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.
trans-unit.target: Use [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) and the rest of the [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace API to send and receive information using the HTTP 2.0 and HTTP 1.1 protocols.

trans-unit.source: Overview of HttpClient and the Windows.Web.Http namespace
trans-unit.target: Overview of HttpClient and the Windows.Web.Http namespace

trans-unit.source: The classes in the [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace and the related [**Windows.Web.Http.Headers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn252713) and [**Windows.Web.Http.Filters**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298623) namespaces provide a programming interface for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps that act as an HTTP client to perform basic GET requests or implement more advanced HTTP functionality listed below.
trans-unit.target: The classes in the [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace and the related [**Windows.Web.Http.Headers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn252713) and [**Windows.Web.Http.Filters**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298623) namespaces provide a programming interface for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps that act as an HTTP client to perform basic GET requests or implement more advanced HTTP functionality listed below.

trans-unit.source: Methods for common verbs (**DELETE**, **GET**, **PUT**, and **POST**).
trans-unit.target: Methods for common verbs (**DELETE**, **GET**, **PUT**, and **POST**).

trans-unit.source: Each of these requests are sent as an asynchronous operation.
trans-unit.target: Each of these requests are sent as an asynchronous operation.

trans-unit.source: Support for common authentication settings and patterns.
trans-unit.target: Support for common authentication settings and patterns.

trans-unit.source: Access to Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) details on the transport.
trans-unit.target: Access to Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) details on the transport.

trans-unit.source: Ability to include customized filters in advanced apps.
trans-unit.target: Ability to include customized filters in advanced apps.

trans-unit.source: Ability to get, set, and delete cookies.
trans-unit.target: Ability to get, set, and delete cookies.

trans-unit.source: HTTP Request progress info available on asynchronous methods.
trans-unit.target: HTTP Request progress info available on asynchronous methods.

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpRequestMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279617) class represents an HTTP request message sent by [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639).
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpRequestMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279617) class represents an HTTP request message sent by [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639).

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279631) class represents an HTTP response message received from an HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279631) class represents an HTTP response message received from an HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: HTTP messages are defined in [RFC 2616](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241642) by the IETF.
trans-unit.target: HTTP messages are defined in [RFC 2616](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=241642) by the IETF.

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace represents HTTP content as the HTTP entity body and headers including cookies.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace represents HTTP content as the HTTP entity body and headers including cookies.

trans-unit.source: HTTP content can be associated with an HTTP request or an HTTP response.
trans-unit.target: HTTP content can be associated with an HTTP request or an HTTP response.

trans-unit.source: The **Windows.Web.Http** namespace provides a number of different classes to represent HTTP content.
trans-unit.target: The **Windows.Web.Http** namespace provides a number of different classes to represent HTTP content.

trans-unit.source: [**HttpBufferContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298625).
trans-unit.target: [**HttpBufferContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298625).

trans-unit.source: Content as a buffer
trans-unit.target: Content as a buffer

trans-unit.source: [**HttpFormUrlEncodedContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298685).
trans-unit.target: [**HttpFormUrlEncodedContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298685).

trans-unit.source: Content as name and value tuples encoded with the **application/x-www-form-urlencoded** MIME type
trans-unit.target: Content as name and value tuples encoded with the **application/x-www-form-urlencoded** MIME type

trans-unit.source: [**HttpMultipartContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298708).
trans-unit.target: [**HttpMultipartContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298708).

trans-unit.source: Content in the form of the **multipart/\*** MIME type.
trans-unit.target: Content in the form of the **multipart/\*** MIME type.

trans-unit.source: [**HttpMultipartFormDataContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279596).
trans-unit.target: [**HttpMultipartFormDataContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279596).

trans-unit.source: Content that is encoded as the **multipart/form-data** MIME type.
trans-unit.target: Content that is encoded as the **multipart/form-data** MIME type.

trans-unit.source: [**HttpStreamContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279649).
trans-unit.target: [**HttpStreamContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279649).

trans-unit.source: Content as a stream (the internal type is used by the HTTP GET method to receive data and the HTTP POST method to upload data)
trans-unit.target: Content as a stream (the internal type is used by the HTTP GET method to receive data and the HTTP POST method to upload data)

trans-unit.source: [**HttpStringContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279661).
trans-unit.target: [**HttpStringContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279661).

trans-unit.source: Content as a string.
trans-unit.target: Content as a string.

trans-unit.source: [**IHttpContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279684) - A base interface for developers to create their own content objects
trans-unit.target: [**IHttpContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279684) - A base interface for developers to create their own content objects

trans-unit.source: The code snippet in the "Send a simple GET request over HTTP" section uses the [**HttpStringContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279661) class to represent the HTTP response from an HTTP GET request as a string.
trans-unit.target: The code snippet in the "Send a simple GET request over HTTP" section uses the [**HttpStringContent**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279661) class to represent the HTTP response from an HTTP GET request as a string.

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Web.Http.Headers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn252713) namespace supports creation of HTTP headers and cookies, which are then associated as properties with [**HttpRequestMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279617) and [**HttpResponseMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279631) objects.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Web.Http.Headers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn252713) namespace supports creation of HTTP headers and cookies, which are then associated as properties with [**HttpRequestMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279617) and [**HttpResponseMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279631) objects.

trans-unit.source: Send a simple GET request over HTTP
trans-unit.target: Send a simple GET request over HTTP

trans-unit.source: As mentioned earlier in this article, the [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace allows UWP apps to send GET requests.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned earlier in this article, the [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace allows UWP apps to send GET requests.

trans-unit.source: The following code snippet demonstrates how to send a GET request to http://www.contoso.com using the [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) class and the [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279631) class to read the response from the GET request.
trans-unit.target: The following code snippet demonstrates how to send a GET request to http://www.contoso.com using the [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) class and the [**Windows.Web.Http.HttpResponseMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279631) class to read the response from the GET request.

trans-unit.source: Exceptions in Windows.Web.Http
trans-unit.target: Exceptions in Windows.Web.Http

trans-unit.source: An exception is thrown when an invalid string for a the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is passed to the constructor for the [**Windows.Foundation.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225998) object.
trans-unit.target: An exception is thrown when an invalid string for a the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) is passed to the constructor for the [**Windows.Foundation.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225998) object.

trans-unit.source: **.NET: **The [**Windows.Foundation.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225998) type appears as [**System.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.uri.aspx) in C# and VB.
trans-unit.target: **.NET: **The [**Windows.Foundation.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225998) type appears as [**System.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.uri.aspx) in C# and VB.

trans-unit.source: In C# and Visual Basic, this error can be avoided by using the [**System.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.uri.aspx) class in the .NET 4.5 and one of the [**System.Uri.TryCreate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.uri.trycreate.aspx) methods to test the string received from a user before the URI is constructed.
trans-unit.target: In C# and Visual Basic, this error can be avoided by using the [**System.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.uri.aspx) class in the .NET 4.5 and one of the [**System.Uri.TryCreate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.uri.trycreate.aspx) methods to test the string received from a user before the URI is constructed.

trans-unit.source: In C++, there is no method to try and parse a string to a URI.
trans-unit.target: In C++, there is no method to try and parse a string to a URI.

trans-unit.source: If an app gets input from the user for the [**Windows.Foundation.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225998), the constructor should be in a try/catch block.
trans-unit.target: If an app gets input from the user for the [**Windows.Foundation.Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225998), the constructor should be in a try/catch block.

trans-unit.source: If an exception is thrown, the app can notify the user and request a new hostname.
trans-unit.target: If an exception is thrown, the app can notify the user and request a new hostname.

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) lacks a convenience function.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) lacks a convenience function.

trans-unit.source: So an app using [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) and other classes in this namespace needs to use the **HRESULT** value.
trans-unit.target: So an app using [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) and other classes in this namespace needs to use the **HRESULT** value.

trans-unit.source: In apps using the .NET Framework 4.5 in C#, VB.NET, the [System.Exception](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.exception.aspx) represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.
trans-unit.target: In apps using the .NET Framework 4.5 in C#, VB.NET, the [System.Exception](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.exception.aspx) represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.

trans-unit.source: The [System.Exception.HResult](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.exception.hresult.aspx) property returns the **HRESULT** assigned to the specific exception.
trans-unit.target: The [System.Exception.HResult](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.exception.hresult.aspx) property returns the **HRESULT** assigned to the specific exception.

trans-unit.source: The [System.Exception.Message](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.exception.message.aspx) property returns the message that describes the exception.
trans-unit.target: The [System.Exception.Message](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.exception.message.aspx) property returns the message that describes the exception.

trans-unit.source: Possible **HRESULT** values are listed in the *Winerror.h* header file.
trans-unit.target: Possible **HRESULT** values are listed in the *Winerror.h* header file.

trans-unit.source: An app can filter on specific **HRESULT** values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.
trans-unit.target: An app can filter on specific **HRESULT** values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.

trans-unit.source: In apps using managed C++, the [Platform::Exception](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh755825.aspx) represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.
trans-unit.target: In apps using managed C++, the [Platform::Exception](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh755825.aspx) represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.

trans-unit.source: The [Platform::Exception::HResult](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh763371.aspx) property returns the **HRESULT** assigned to the specific exception.
trans-unit.target: The [Platform::Exception::HResult](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh763371.aspx) property returns the **HRESULT** assigned to the specific exception.

trans-unit.source: The [Platform::Exception::Message](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh763375.aspx) property returns the system-provided string that is associated with the **HRESULT** value.
trans-unit.target: The [Platform::Exception::Message](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh763375.aspx) property returns the system-provided string that is associated with the **HRESULT** value.

trans-unit.source: Possible **HRESULT** values are listed in the *Winerror.h* header file.
trans-unit.target: Possible **HRESULT** values are listed in the *Winerror.h* header file.

trans-unit.source: An app can filter on specific **HRESULT** values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.
trans-unit.target: An app can filter on specific **HRESULT** values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.

trans-unit.source: For most parameter validation errors, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_INVALIDARG**.
trans-unit.target: For most parameter validation errors, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_INVALIDARG**.

trans-unit.source: For some illegal method calls, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_ILLEGAL\_METHOD\_CALL**.
trans-unit.target: For some illegal method calls, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_ILLEGAL\_METHOD\_CALL**.
